image.altText: A man in a suit speaking in an interview in a concerned manner

props.synopsis: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

title.children: SA Labor stalwart and former federal minister Nick Bolkus dies

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression and black hair takes a selfie

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

title.children: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail

image.altText: A women holds up four different types of frozen prawns in bags

props.synopsis: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

title.children: Peeled or whole? How we buy prawns reveals a growing generational divide

image.altText: Peter Drew pastes up a poster

props.synopsis: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

title.children: 'Aussie' poster in Adelaide vandalised with 'white power' graffiti

image.altText: A Santa Claus sitting on a throne surrounded by presents at kids festival

props.synopsis: South Australia's Christmas traditions have evolved from the days of John Martin's Magic Cave. So, can the state lay claim to being the most festive in Australia?

title.children: Is South Australia the most festive state?

image.altText: An opened box of silver tube-like detonators on top of a red file on the table

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

title.children: Weapons, detonators allegedly found in Adelaide's north

image.altText: Woman wearing colouful top and apron stands smiling in her kitchen with cakes wrapped in colourful paper on bench next to her

props.synopsis: As households across the world sit down to enjoy a festive feast, Faye Taylor revels in knowing 500 of her traditional Christmas cakes are bringing enjoyment and helping raise funds for people in need.

title.children: Faye's great Christmas cake baking mission

image.altText: A crashed up motorcycle surrounded by police, traffic cones and paramedics as well as a yellow tarpaulin

props.synopsis: The men, both in their 60s, crashed at the intersection of Main South Road and Sunvalley Road in O'Halloran Hill on Tuesday.

title.children: Two killed in crash between car and motorcycle in Adelaide's south

image.altText: A woman and a black labrador dog stand in front of a vast outback landscape

props.synopsis: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

title.children: Seeing eye dog Mika is helping station owner navigate life on the land

image.altText: A man applies a paperbark splint to a woman's ankle

props.synopsis: With no mobile phone coverage and no chance of anyone hearing her call out, Margie Moroney decided to crawl back to the campsite she was sharing with her colleagues.

title.children: Woman survives 500-metre crawl with broken ankle in remote Arnhem Land

image.altText: A smiling woman sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles outside his house which is swamped by Christmas lights

props.synopsis: Families from all over Adelaide visit Joe Ferraro's home to marvel at his Christmas display, which he has amassed a collection of more than 50,000 lights since he began nearly 20 years ago.

title.children: The Christmas display that charms kids, adults and nuns visiting on a minibus

image.altText: A red sign that says "sale" in white writing is placed on a display rack of shoes.

props.synopsis: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

title.children: Australians tipped to spend record $1.6b on Boxing Day sales

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

props.synopsis: Cashless payments make up about three-quarters of all transactions in Australia but come at a cost to both merchants and consumers, leaving some asking if it is time to consider it essential infrastructure.

title.children: What are you really paying when using a card this Christmas?

image.altText: A man in a beekeeping suit holds a hive frame which is covered in bees

props.synopsis: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

title.children: Tiny, destructive varroa mite has SA beekeepers on high alert

image.altText: A house with damage to its front entrance with a black Mercedes-Benz car parked in the front yard

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

title.children: Man who hired crane to attack another man's home gets home detention

image.altText: A sign with blue text that says Bedford.

props.synopsis: Creditors have voted to support the sale of Bedford to NDIS provider The Disability Trust, which would guarantee the jobs of 1,100 workers.

title.children: Creditors vote in favor to sell Bedford to NDIS disability provider

image.altText: Photo of a man with grey hair wearing a red top.

props.synopsis: A 49-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the alleged murder of 72-year-old Gary Hallam at the Big 4 Port Willunga Tourist Park at Aldinga in Adelaide's south on Monday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after suspicious death at Adelaide holiday park

image.altText: A hand reaches for bunches of white grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

title.children: Long-awaited mandatory wine industry code of conduct too late for growers

image.altText: Gennaro Rapinese and Candice

props.synopsis: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

title.children: US student to spend Christmas with Perth man after saving his life

image.altText: Joffrs Archer during England's tour match at Lilac Hill.

props.synopsis: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

title.children: Stokes defends teammates as Archer's Ashes ends

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and red tie smiling while holding a blue smartphone in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he wants the United States to lead the world in the "6G race" and has given his government one year to find out how to begin making it happen.

title.children: Trump wants the US to lead on 6G. Here's when Australia could get it

image.altText: A pool framed by palm trees, with the ocean and people walking along a promenade in the background.

props.synopsis: An American equity firm plans to purchase the jewel of the Whitsundays.

title.children: $1.2 billion Hamilton Island sale labelled 'extraordinary'

image.altText: People swim near a reef at Trigg Beach

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

title.children: Girl found unresponsive in water at Perth beach after being caught in rip

image.altText: AFP nazi charges Brisbane

props.synopsis: The Australian government has promised changes to make it easier to deport people who spread hateful views.

title.children: British man's visa cancelled after being charged with displaying Nazi symbols

image.altText: Dancing in Rain Niamh Swingler

props.synopsis: Residents on a remote Indian Ocean Territory are bunkering down and scrapping Christmas plans as Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches.

title.children: Island residents brace for Christmas cyclone as rain and wind bears down

image.altText: two men in christmas outfits in snow

props.synopsis: Which Christmas hits didn't do as well on the charts as you'd think? Test your knowledge of festive cheer.

title.children: Do you know how to make the gravy? Test your Christmas song knowledge

image.altText: an illustration of the house shows sun light being captured and pushed into the living room where a family sits

props.synopsis: On December 24, 1948, a family of Hungarian refugees moved into a small house in Dover, Massachusetts.  But there was a catch.

title.children: 'She Trapped the Sun': Inside the world's first solar house

image.altText: A woman lies in a hospital bed with a peaceful smile on her face while a younger woman sits beside her, holding her hand.

props.synopsis: Dame Helen Mirren has a rule that she will never play someone with dementia or dying of cancer. She broke that rule for Kate Winslet, after reading the script for Goodbye June.

title.children: Kate Winslet's son wrote a screenplay — and he asked his mum to direct it

image.altText: Security guards patrolling Fed Square

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has confirmed it is consulting with the administrators of a collapsed Melbourne-based security firm as 1,700 jobs hang in the balance.

title.children: Victorian government consults with administrators of collapsed security firm

image.altText: Sheik Abdulghani Albaf infront of a sign

props.synopsis: A NSW Islamic school could face de-registration if it does not provide evidence its principal is "fit and proper".

title.children: Islamic school faces de-registration over comments about Zionism

image.altText: A man wearing red robes with white trim, with a big white beard throws ice, in front of a palm tree and blue skies.

props.synopsis: Santa Claus has devised a special ice esky throne to beat the heat in outback Australia this year.

title.children: Tropical Santa goes high-tech to beat the summer heat

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT pauses all grants of aid for December, meaning people in the territory held in custody over Christmas — including children — will not have access to a legal aid lawyer.

title.children: Low-income adults and kids in jail denied lawyers over Christmas

image.altText: ABC's AM presenter Sabra Lane smiling

props.synopsis: Sabra Lane is farewelling the ABC's AM after nine years of hosting the current affairs radio program.

title.children: ABC radio host Sabra Lane farewells AM after nine years

image.altText: A man stands behind a counter with christian figurines on the side and in shelves behind him.

props.synopsis: For the first time in two years, Bethlehem has restarted its Christmas festivities to "reignite the spirit that everybody needs" while Palestinians continue to live under restrictions.

title.children: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem after two years as Palestinians hope for 'better future'
